Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.ptugen.ptugen

from __future__ import absolute_import, division, print_function, unicode_literals
import os
import logging
import sys
import time
import re

sys.path.append(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", ".."))

from havoc.lib.filesystem_actions import FilesystemActions
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.site_utils import SiteUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.generic_utils import GenericUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import (
    TimeoutError,
)
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_thread import AutovalThread
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.host import Host


[docs]class Ptugen(TestBase):
    """
    This test module will run ptugen and allows you to choose a sequence of
    power levels.
    Parameters:
    mode: sequence = follow 'sequence' list and 'interval'
          random sequence = randomize 'sequence' and follow 'interval'
          random = randomize 'sequence' and 'interval'
    sequence: a list power levels [c0, c1, c3, c6, c7]
    interval: interval between power level changes in seconds
    runtime: total run time
    """

    REQ_ARGS = ["runtime", "run_definition"]


[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(Ptugen, self).__init__()
        self.args = {}
        self.srcdir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))
        self.tooldir = SiteUtils().get_tool_path()
        self.args["runtime"] = self.test_control.get("runtime", 600)
        self.args["run_definition"] = self.test_control.get("run_definition")

        # CPU test selection
        # 0 = none    1 = TDP test    2 = Core power level test (default)
        # 3 = Core AVX test    4 = Pmax test
        self.args["cputest"] = self.test_control.get("cputest", 2)

        # 64-bit mask for cpu (2 cpu)
        self.args["cpumask"] = self.test_control.get("cpumask", 0x03)

        # 64-bit mask for cores (all)
        self.args["coremask"] = self.test_control.get("coremask", 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF)

        # Memory test selection
        # 0 = none
        # 1 = Read test
        # 2 = Write test
        # 3 = Read/Write test
        self.args["memtest"] = self.test_control.get("memtest", 0)

        # sequence = repeat sequence until end
        # randseq = random sequence (TODO)
        # randint = random interval (TODO)
        # randseqint = random seq and int (TODO)
        self.args["mode"] = self.test_control.get("mode", "sequence")

        # put ptugen into single core stress mode
        self.args["corescan"] = self.test_control.get("corescan", False)

        # time to stress each core
        self.args["corescan_interval"] = self.test_control.get("corescan_interval", 60)

        # (applicable to core scan)
        self.args["turbo_freq_check"] = self.test_control.get("turbo_freq_check", False)

        self.cpu_skylake = "skylake"
        self.cpu_broadwell = "broadwell"

        self.keep_looping = False
        self.fs_actions = FilesystemActions()

        # will hold list of dictionaries based on socket count
        self.cpu_freq_list = [{"frequencies": [], "top_cpu_freq": 0}]



[docs]    def set_binaries_paths(self):
        self.skylake_package_folder = "ptu_skylake_rev1.9"
        self.broadwell_de_package_folder = "ptu_bdw_de_rev1.6"
        tool_path = os.path.join(self.tooldir, "ptugen")

        #get binary based on cpu type
        self.ptugen_binaries = {
            "skylake ep": {"tar": tool_path + "/ptu_skylake_rev1.9.tgz",
                "ptugen" : os.path.join(self.tmpdir,
                       "ptu_skylake_rev1.9" + "/ptugen"),
                "ptumon" : os.path.join(self.tmpdir,
                       "ptu_skylake_rev1.9" + "/ptumon")},
            "skylake de": {"tar": tool_path + "/ptu_skylake_rev1.9.tgz",
                "ptugen" : os.path.join(self.tmpdir,
                       "ptu_skylake_rev1.9" + "/ptugen"),
                "ptumon" : os.path.join(self.tmpdir,
                       "ptu_skylake_rev1.9" + "/ptumon")},
            "broadwell ep": {"tar": tool_path + "/ptu_bdw_rev0.9.tgz",
                "ptugen" : os.path.join(self.tmpdir,
                       "ptu_bdw_rev0.9" + "/ptugen"),
                "ptumon" : os.path.join(self.tmpdir,
                        "ptu_bdw_rev0.9" + "/ptumon")},
            "broadwell de": {"tar" : tool_path + "/ptu_bdw_de_rev1.6.tgz",
                "ptugen" : os.path.join(self.tmpdir,
                        "ptu_bdw_de_rev1.6" + "/ptugen"),
                "ptumon" : os.path.join(self.tmpdir,
                        "ptu_bdw_de_rev1.6" + "/ptumon")}
        }

        logging.info("tmpdir is %s" % self.tmpdir)

        new_dict = self.ptugen_binaries.get(self.cputype)
        tarball = new_dict["tar"]
        self.binary_ptugen = new_dict["ptugen"]
        self.binary_ptumon = new_dict["ptumon"]

        GenericUtils.extract(tarball, self.tmpdir)
        AutovalUtils.validate_condition(tarball, "ptugen tool path %s " % tarball)



[docs]    def setup(self):
        """
        Extracts the ptugen binary
        """
        super(Ptugen, self).setup()

        self.cpuinfo = self.get_cpuinfo()
        self.cputype = self.cpuinfo["cpu_processor_type"].lower()
        self.cpu_sockets = int(self.cpuinfo["cpu_sockets"])
        self.set_binaries_paths()
        if self.cpu_sockets > 1:
            # add another item to list of cpu frequencies
            self.cpu_freq_list.append({"frequencies": [], "top_cpu_freq": 0})

        # same number for all sockets
        self.target_package_freq = 0



[docs]    def get_cpuinfo(self):
        params = None
        class_name = None
        remote_module_function = "get_cpuinfo"
        remote_module = "validation_utils.lib.system_config.cpu_info"
        controller_host = AutovalUtils.get_host()
        AutovalUtils.set_host(self.host)
        cpu_info = AutovalUtils.run_remote_module(
            remote_module, remote_module_function, params, class_name
        )
        AutovalUtils.set_host(controller_host)
        return cpu_info



[docs]    def get_target_package_frequency(self):
        cpuinfo = self.cpuinfo
        logging.info("CPU type is %s" % self.cputype)
        # Set up a core scan sequence based on core count
        if self.args["corescan"]:
            corescan_seq = []
            corecnt = int(cpuinfo["cpu_cores_per_socket"])
            initmask = 0x1
            i = 0
            while i < corecnt:
                corescan_seq.append(initmask)
                initmask = initmask << 1
                i += 1
        # Check turbo
        turbo_supported = cpuinfo["cpu_turbo_supported"]
        turbo_enabled = cpuinfo["cpu_turbo_enabled"]
        percent = cpuinfo["cpu_turbo_core_enabled_percent"]
        if self.args["turbo_freq_check"]:
            if not turbo_supported or not turbo_enabled or not percent == 100.0:
                logging.info("CPU TURBO is disabled. Enabling")
                cpuinfo = self.enable_turbo(True)

        else:
            if turbo_supported or turbo_enabled or percent != 0.0:
                logging.info("CPU TURBO is enabled. Disabling")
                cpuinfo = self.enable_turbo(False)
        # set up a turbo freq check on core count
        self.target_package_freq = self.get_turbo_freq_ptumon()
        self.validate_condition(
            self.target_package_freq,
            "Target package frequency is %f" % self.target_package_freq
        )
        # updating again self.cpuinfo after enabling or disabling turbo
        self.cpuinfo = cpuinfo



[docs]    def get_cpu_frequencies(self, socket):
        for i in range(self.cpu_sockets):
            self.cpu_freq_list[i]["frequencies"] = []

        # Parsing
        frequencies_file = "%s/frequencies" % self.resultsdir
        output = self.host.run("cat %s" % frequencies_file)
        logging.info("frequency file is: %s" % frequencies_file)
        lines = output.split("\n")

        for line in lines:
            # if skylake, skylake can have more than 1 socket but there is
            # no comma between to use the else part of the if.
            # Both sockets have same frequencies and that's
            # why we check here for skylake.
            if (self.cpu_skylake in self.cputype
                    or self.cpu_sockets == 1):
                cpu0_freq = line.rstrip("\r\n")
                self.cpu_freq_list[0]["frequencies"].append(cpu0_freq)
            else:
                (cpu0_freq, cpu1_freq) = line.rstrip("\r\n").split(",")
                self.cpu_freq_list[0]["frequencies"].append(cpu0_freq)
                if (self.cpu_sokets > 1):
                    self.cpu_freq_list[1]["frequencies"].append(cpu1_freq)

        return self.cpu_freq_list[socket]["frequencies"]



[docs]    def get_cpu_top_freq(self, socket):
        frequencies = self.get_cpu_frequencies(socket)
        top_cpu_freq = 0
        for i in range(len(frequencies)):
            if (float(frequencies[i]) <= float(self.target_package_freq)
                       and (float(frequencies[i]) > float(top_cpu_freq))):
                top_cpu_freq = float(frequencies[i])
        return top_cpu_freq



[docs]    def check_cpu_hit_turbo_freq(self):
        # Checking whether CPU hits the turbo freq
        sockets_count = self.cpu_sockets
        for socket in range(sockets_count):
            self.cpu_freq_list[socket]["top_cpu_freq"] = self.get_cpu_top_freq(socket)
        self.validate_turbo()



[docs]    def validate_turbo(self):
        # Validate 10% difference if Turbo
        if self.args["turbo_freq_check"]:
            self.validate_greater(
                float(self.cpu_freq_list[0]["top_cpu_freq"]),
                self.target_package_freq * 0.9,
                "CPU0 Turbo - Target: %f, Top: %f"
                % (self.target_package_freq,
                    float(self.cpu_freq_list[0]["top_cpu_freq"]))
            )
            # don't include skylake
            if (self.cpu_skylake not in
                    self.cputype) and (self.cpu_sockets > 1):
                    self.validate_greater(
                        float(self.cpu_freq_list[1]["top_cpu_freq"]),
                        self.target_package_freq * 0.9,
                        "CPU1 Turbo - Target: %f, Top: %f"
                        % (self.target_package_freq,
                            float(self.cpu_freq_list[1]["top_cpu_freq"])),
                    )
        # Print without Turbo
        else:
            self.validate_condition(
                True,
                "CPU0 without Turbo - Target: %f, Top: %s"
                % (self.target_package_freq, self.cpu_freq_list[0]["top_cpu_freq"]),
            )
        # don't include skylake
        if self.cpu_skylake not in self.cputype and self.cpu_sockets > 1:
                self.validate_condition(
                    True,
                    "CPU1 without Turbo \
                    - Target: %f, Top : %s"
                    % (self.target_package_freq, self.cpu_freq_list[1]["top_cpu_freq"]),
                )



[docs]    def generate_command(self, cpupower, cpumask, coremask):
        """
        Generates a ptugen command line based on self.args
        """
        ptu_dir = None
        self.bin = self.binary_ptugen
        if self.broadwell_de_package_folder in self.bin :
            # ptugen for bdw de has different CLI options
            ptu_dir, ptu_file = os.path.split(self.bin)
            cmd = "yes y | ./%s " % (ptu_file)
            if self.args["corescan"]:
                cmd += "-core0x%x " % coremask
            cmd += "-P%d " % cpupower
            if not self.args["turbo_freq_check"]:
                cmd += "-b"
        elif self.skylake_package_folder in self.bin :
            # ptugen for skylake has different CLI options
            ptu_dir, ptu_file = os.path.split(self.bin)
            cmd = "yes y | ./%s " % (ptu_file)
            if self.args["corescan"]:
                cmd += "-cpu 0x%x " % cpumask
                cmd += "-core 0x%x " % coremask
            if self.args["turbo_freq_check"]:
                cmd += "-ct 6 -b 1 "
            else:
                cmd += "-ct 2 -cp %d " % cpupower
        else:
            # ptugen always requires to acknowledge the license with "y"
            cmd = "yes y | " + self.bin + " "
            if self.args["corescan"]:
                cmd += "-cpu 0x%x " % cpumask
                cmd += "-core 0x%x " % coremask
            cmd += "-ct %d " % self.args["cputest"]
            cmd += "-mt %d " % self.args["memtest"]
            cmd += "-p %d " % cpupower
        logging.info("cmd %s " % cmd)
        return (cmd, ptu_dir)



[docs]    def get_turbo_freq_ptumon(self):
        # if broadwell
        if self.cpu_broadwell in self.cputype:
            turbo_val = self.get_turbo_freq_ptumon_broadwell()
            if (not turbo_val):
                return None
        # if skylake
        elif self.cpu_skylake in self.cputype:
            turbo_val = self.get_turbo_freq_ptumon_skylake()
            if (not turbo_val):
                return None
        else:
            err_msg = "This method is not supported for your CPU."
            err_msg += "Please implement the check in your CPU or "
            err_msg += "disable the turbo_freq_check option."
            raise Exception(err_msg)
        return turbo_val



[docs]    def get_turbo_freq_ptumon_broadwell(self):
            self.bin = self.binary_ptumon
            # find core reported by ptumon
            cmd = "yes y | " + self.bin + " -y -t 1"
            logging.info("command %s  " % cmd)
            output = self.host.run(cmd)
            # use raw string to prevent invalid escape sequence
            find_core = re.compile(r"Number of Cores\W+(\d+)")
            result = find_core.search(output)
            if result is not None:
                core = int(result.group(1))
            else:
                logging.debug("cannot find core")
                return None
            # find freq associated with all cores
            find_turbo_bash = "%dC:" % core
            # use raw string to prevent invalid escape sequence
            search_string = r"%s(\d+)x" % find_turbo_bash
            find_turbo_re = re.compile(search_string)
            result = find_turbo_re.search(output)
            if result:
                turbo_val = int(result.group(1))
                turbo_val = turbo_val * 100
            else:
                logging.debug("Cannot find max core turbo frequency")
                return None
            return turbo_val



[docs]    def get_turbo_freq_ptumon_skylake(self):
            self.bin = self.binary_ptumon
            # find core reported by ptumon
            cmd = "yes y | " + self.bin + " -y -t 1"
            logging.info("command %s  " % cmd)
            output = self.host.run(cmd)
            find_core = re.compile(r"Number of Physcial Cores\W+(\d+)")
            result = find_core.search(output)
            if result is not None:
                core = int(result.group(1))
            else:
                logging.debug("cannot find core")
                return None
            # find freq associated with all cores
            find_turbo_bash = "Core Count Range %d:" % core
            search_string = r"%s ([0-9]*) (\w+)" % find_turbo_bash
            find_turbo_re = re.compile(search_string)
            result = find_turbo_re.search(output)
            if result:
                unit = result.group(2)
                if "GHz" in unit:
                    turbo_val = int(float(result.group(1)) * 1000)
                else:
                    turbo_val = int(result.group(1))
            else:
                logging.debug("Cannot find max core turbo frequency")
                return None
            return turbo_val



[docs]    def get_current_pkg_freq(self):
        host = Host(self.hosts[0])
        # if broadwell
        if self.cpu_broadwell in self.cputype:
            self.bin = self.binary_ptumon
            find_heading = "CPU CORE THREAD"
            cmd = (
                "yes y | "
                + self.bin
                + ' -y -t 1 | grep "%s" -A 1 | tail -n 1' % find_heading
            )
            output = host.run(cmd)
            freq_list = []
            regex_str = r"^\S+\s+\S+\s+\S+\s+\S+\s+\S+\s+(\S+)"
            regex_obj = re.compile(regex_str)
            for line in output.split("\n"):
                result = regex_obj.search(line)
                if result:
                    freq_list.append(result.group(1))
        # if skylake
        elif self.cpu_skylake in self.cputype:
            self.bin = self.binary_ptumon
            find_heading = "Cor Thr MC"
            cmd = (
                "yes y | "
                + self.bin
                + ' -y -t 1 | grep "%s" -A 1 | tail -n 1' % find_heading
            )
            output = host.run(cmd)
            freq_list = []
            regex_str = r"(?<!\d)(\d{4})(?!\d)"
            regex_obj = re.compile(regex_str)
            for line in output.split("\n"):
                result = regex_obj.search(line)
                if result:
                    # frequency is in GHz
                    freq_mhz = float(result.group(1))
                    freq_list.append(str(freq_mhz))
        else:
            return None
        return freq_list



[docs]    def poll_frequency_and_update(self):
        while self.keep_looping:
            str = "%s\n" % ",".join(self.get_current_pkg_freq())
            self.fs_actions.write_file(
                "%s/frequencies" % self.resultsdir,
                str,
                append=True,
                json_file=False,
            )
            time.sleep(60)



[docs]    def enable_turbo(self, flag=True):
        if flag:
            # Enable turbo
            cmd = "wrmsr --all 0x1a0 0x850089"
            self.host.run(cmd)
            cpuinfo = self.get_cpuinfo()
            turbo_supported = cpuinfo["cpu_turbo_supported"]
            turbo_enabled = cpuinfo["cpu_turbo_enabled"]
            percent = cpuinfo["cpu_turbo_core_enabled_percent"]
            self.validate_condition(turbo_supported, "CPU TURBO is supported")
            self.validate_condition(turbo_enabled, "CPU TURBO is enabled")
            self.validate_equal(percent, 100.0, "CPU TURBO is enabled on 100%")
        else:
            # Disable turbo
            cmd = "wrmsr --all 0x1a0 0x4000850089"
            self.host.run(cmd)
            cpuinfo = self.get_cpuinfo()
            turbo_supported = cpuinfo["cpu_turbo_supported"]
            turbo_enabled = cpuinfo["cpu_turbo_enabled"]
            percent = cpuinfo["cpu_turbo_core_enabled_percent"]
            self.validate_condition(not turbo_supported, "CPU TURBO is not supported")
            self.validate_condition(not turbo_enabled, "CPU TURBO is not enabled")
            self.validate_equal(percent, 0.0, "CPU TURBO is enabled on 0%")
        return cpuinfo



[docs]    def run_ptugen(self):
        corescan_seq = []
        cpuinfo = self.cpuinfo
        corecnt = int(cpuinfo["cpu_cores_per_socket"])
        run_index = 0
        endtime = time.time() + self.args["runtime"]
        while time.time() < endtime:
            self.keep_looping = True
            queue_list = []
            queue_list.append(
                AutovalThread.start_autoval_thread(self.poll_frequency_and_update))
            # Corescan Specifc Iteration Update
            if self.args["corescan"]:
                setcpumask = self.args["cpumask"]
                setcoremask = corescan_seq[run_index]
                setpower = 100
                setinterval = self.args["corescan_interval"]

                # increment sequence
                run_index += 1
                if run_index >= corecnt:
                    run_index = 0
            else:
                setcpumask = self.args["cpumask"]
                setcoremask = self.args["coremask"]
                setpower = self.args["run_definition"][run_index]["sequence"]
                setinterval = self.args["run_definition"][run_index]["interval"]

                # increment sequence
                run_index += 1
                if run_index >= len(self.args["run_definition"]):
                    run_index = 0

            logging.info(
                "***** Starting sequence. %d seconds remaining *****"
                % (endtime - time.time())
            )

            if setpower == 0:
                # Power level 0 can be used to indicate a sleep instead of
                # ptugen run (simulate 0% load)
                logging.info("***** Sleeping %s seconds *****" % (setinterval))
                time.sleep(setinterval)
                # cause the thread to exit when self.keep_looping is False
                self.keep_looping = False
                AutovalThread.wait_for_autoval_thread(queue_list)
                continue

            logging.info("***** P%s - %s sec *****" % (setpower, setinterval))

            # TODO: modify this method to include core and cpu mask
            (cmd, working_dir) = self.generate_command(setpower, setcpumask,
                    setcoremask)
            logging.info("Runnig command from  working directory %s" % working_dir)
            logging.info("==[%s]== timeout: [%d]" % (cmd, setinterval))
            try:
                self.host.run(cmd, timeout=setinterval,
                        working_directory=working_dir)
            except TimeoutError:
                pass

            # cause the thread to exit when self.keep_looping is False.
            # It causes exit from the function
            self.keep_looping = False
            AutovalThread.wait_for_autoval_thread(queue_list)
        logging.info("ptugen completed successfully")
        self.host.run("pkill ptugen", ignore_status=True)



[docs]    def execute(self):
        """
        Run sequence of ptugen tests
        """
        self.get_target_package_frequency()
        self.run_ptugen()
        self.check_cpu_hit_turbo_freq()




[docs]def main():
    test = Ptugen()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
